item.description:
Life is good.  So let's engineer ourselves more if it!  Well, at least we'll learn what James Collins and colleagues are up to at Harvard, as they discuss what they're learning from their computer models of life itself.  And of course enjoy a pint or two as we nerds pick their brains.  Come join us for the summer's final installment of Science by the Pint at Tavern in the Square in Porter Square.

Let's get there by 6:30 so we can get beer and food in time for the 7:00 presentation.  We'll be in the back left corner of the main room by the bar (not the room all the way in the back on the right).

Parking can be found if you're vigilant, but there's a big bright beautiful red T that stops right there.

Hope to see you!

https://sitn.hms.harvard.edu/science-by-the-pint/

http://www.taverninthesquare.com/tavporter/
item.how_to_find_us: Look for us at the left rear corner of the main room across from the bar
item.name: Science by the Pint - Engineering Life: Learning From Models
